title: Human Services Department 2000-2001 Annual Report
subject: employment programs

description: The mission of the School-Based Program is to enhance social and academic success for students and their families through a coordinated delivery of social services. [...] • Enhancement of the ability of the child and family to relate to one another. [...] 4 Community The mission of the Community Services Division is to serve as a catalyst for Services self-determination and active participation in the greater community for people in crisis through the provision of caring social services. [...] Division The Community Services Division (CSD) provides case management, advocacy, emergency food, utility and rent assistance, heating and cooling repairs, assistance to homeless people, and information and referral services to the residents of Phoenix. [...] Funds were provided to restore the electricity and the caseworker negotiated a payment plan with the landlord to catch up on the delinquent rent. [...] Employment The mission of the Employment and Training Division is to facilitate and and Training promote employment, training, and career advancement opportunities for a variety of populations. [...] The key principles of the Workforce Investment Act (WIA) are to provide universal access to labor market information, training opportunities and job search strategies for all job seekers, and to create a skilled workforce to meet the demands of local businesses. [...] 12 Senior The mission of the Senior Services Division is to develop, coordinate, and Services operate a number of diverse programs to meet the needs of elderly and physically challenged Phoenix residents. [...] These include the Volunteer Recognition luncheon for 600 to 800 volunteers, the Senior Center Bazaar showcasing arts and crafts made by senior center participants, the annual Senior Holiday Party for more than 1,000 participants, the "Home for the Holidays" project with Southwest Airlines sending low-income seniors to visit relatives over the holidays, and various Senior Companion events. [...] Staff filed a report with Adult Protective Services, and the Police came to the center with representatives from the crime lab to photograph the participant's bruises.

abstract: The mission of the School-Based Program is to enhance social and academic success for students and their families through a coordinated delivery of social services. [...] • Enhancement of the ability of the child and family to relate to one another. [...] 4 Community The mission of the Community Services Division is to serve as a catalyst for Services self-determination and active participation in the greater community for people in crisis through the provision of caring social services. [...] Division The Community Services Division (CSD) provides case management, advocacy, emergency food, utility and rent assistance, heating and cooling repairs, assistance to homeless people, and information and referral services to the residents of Phoenix. [...] Funds were provided to restore the electricity and the caseworker negotiated a payment plan with the landlord to catch up on the delinquent rent. [...] Employment The mission of the Employment and Training Division is to facilitate and and Training promote employment, training, and career advancement opportunities for a variety of populations. [...] The key principles of the Workforce Investment Act (WIA) are to provide universal access to labor market information, training opportunities and job search strategies for all job seekers, and to create a skilled workforce to meet the demands of local businesses. [...] 12 Senior The mission of the Senior Services Division is to develop, coordinate, and Services operate a number of diverse programs to meet the needs of elderly and physically challenged Phoenix residents. [...] These include the Volunteer Recognition luncheon for 600 to 800 volunteers, the Senior Center Bazaar showcasing arts and crafts made by senior center participants, the annual Senior Holiday Party for more than 1,000 participants, the "Home for the Holidays" project with Southwest Airlines sending low-income seniors to visit relatives over the holidays, and various Senior Companion events. [...] Staff filed a report with Adult Protective Services, and the Police came to the center with representatives from the crime lab to photograph the participant's bruises.
